author: Detroit Free Press
title: New entry in Michigan governor's race: Detroit health chief
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email New entry in Michigan governor's race: Detroit health chief After watching the Flint water crisis unfold, Detroit's public health director is quitting his job to run for governor. Check out this story on Freep.com: http://on.freep.com/2k8ZT34 Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address.   1 To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs New entry in Michigan governor's race: Detroit health chief Joe Guillen , Detroit Free Press 4:43 p.m. ET Feb. 9, 2017 Director resigns his post with the city of Detroit Buy Photo (Photo: Detroit Free Press) Buy Photo 29 CONNECT 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
After watching the Flint water crisis unfold, Detroit's public health director is quitting his job to run for governor. 
Dr. Abdul El-Sayed, a 32-year-old Democrat, said he wants to restore values that leaders in Lansing seem to have forgotten. 
“I know that this state can be so much better," El-Sayed said today. "We’ve seen throughout the past administration the failure to invest in the things that matter, whether that was public health or public education.”
